Package com.therekrab.autopilot

Class APTarget

java.lang.Object
com.therekrab.autopilot.APTarget
public class APTarget extends Object
The APTarget class represents the goal end state of an Autopilot action. A target needs a reference Pose2d, but can optionally have a specified entry angle and rotation radius. A target may also specify an end velocity or end velocity.

    • withEntryAngle

      Parameters:
      entryAngle - The entry angle for the new target.

    • withVelocity

      public APTarget withVelocity(double velocity)
      Returns a copy of this target with the given end velocity. Note that if the robot does not reach this velocity, no issues will be thrown. Autopilot will only try to reach this target, but it will not be affected by whether it does.
      Parameters:
      velocity - The desired end velocity when the robot approaches the target

    • withRotationRadius

      public APTarget withRotationRadius(Distance radius)
      Returns a copy of this target with the given rotation radius.

      Rotation radius is the distance from the target pose that rotation goals are respected.

      By default, rotation goals are always respected. Adjusting this radius prevents Autopilot from reorienting the robot until the robot is within the specified radius of the target.

      Parameters:
      radius - The rotation radius for the new target

    • getReference

      public Pose2d getReference()
      Returns this target's reference Pose2d.

    • withoutEntryAngle

      public APTarget withoutEntryAngle()
      Retuns a copy of this target, without the entry angle set.

      This is useful if trying to make two different targets with and without entry angle set.
